name: No Winter Maintenance
description:
NO WINTER MAINTENANCE

WEEK 9 PROMPT:  "To Endure"

FOCUS:  Make something stupid hard

No Winter Maintenance is hard.  When I first got this prompt, I immediately thought of two things: bouldering and Bennett Foddy (who happens to run this course). I've played a lot of sports in my life, but bouldering, by far, takes the most endurance- both mental and physical. And Foddy games are... well... So naturally, I wanted to make something really difficult. I took the idea of GIRP (letter-based rock climbing) and added some elements that I've always wanted to throw into a rock-climbing system: a belay subsystem and environmental factors. I found the convergence of these elements really fun and exciting... but really challenging as well. I wasn't concerned with hyper-realism and instead wanted to maintain a more cartoony but recognizable physics system. No Winter Maintenance is a short experience about endurance, so don't give up!

KeyboardClick and hold a rock's key to stay anchored OR click a grapple rock's key once to attach and click it once again to releaseLeft/Right ArrowsQuickly and repeatedly click to raise a loose arm (left arrow for left arm, right arrow for right arm)Up/Down ArrowsClick to adjust rope length once grappled to a rockEscRestart the game

It's probably buggy, but it's a prototype! Let me know if you encounter any wild bugs, and I'll look into them :)
